answer_html: As \(\displaystyle n = 3^{2} \cdot 11\), we see that n does not take this form and so there are no primitive roots.
answer_latex:
As $\displaystyle n = 3^{2} \cdot 11$, we see
that \emph{n} does not take this form and so there are no primitive
roots.
hints_html: The number of primitive roots modulo n is equal to \(\displaystyle \phi(n)\) provided that \(n \in \{2,4,p^{k},2p^{k}\}\) for some odd prime p.
hints_latex:
The number of primitive roots modulo n is equal to
$\displaystyle \phi(n)$ provided that $n \in \{2,4,p^{k},2p^{k}\}$ for
some odd prime \emph{p}.
hints_raw: The number of primitive roots modulo n is equal to <math> \displaystyle \phi(n)</math> provided that <math>n \in \{2,4,p^{k},2p^{k}\} </math> for some odd prime ''p''.
sols_html:
The answer is a = 0

The number of primitive roots modulo n is equal to \(\displaystyle \phi(n)\) provided that \(n \in \{2,4,p^{k},2p^{k}\}\) for some odd prime p. As \(\displaystyle n = 3^{2} \cdot 11\), we see that n does not take this form and so there are no primitive roots.
sols_latex:
The answer is \textbf{a = 0}

The number of primitive roots modulo n is equal to
$\displaystyle \phi(n)$ provided that $n \in \{2,4,p^{k},2p^{k}\}$ for
some odd prime \emph{p}. As $\displaystyle n = 3^{2} \cdot 11$, we see
that \emph{n} does not take this form and so there are no primitive
roots.
sols_raw:
The answer is '''a = 0'''

The number of primitive roots modulo n is equal to <math> \displaystyle \phi(n)</math> provided that <math>n \in \{2,4,p^{k},2p^{k}\} </math> for some odd prime ''p''. As <math> \displaystyle n = 3^{2} \cdot 11 </math>, we see that ''n'' does not take this form and so there are no primitive roots.
statement_html:
Multiple Choice

The number of primitive roots of 99 is

  • (a) 0

  • (b) 8

  • (c) 34

  • (d) 66

  • (e) None of the above.
statement_latex:
\textbf{Multiple Choice}

The number of primitive roots of 99 is

\begin{itemize}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  (a) 0
\item
  (b) 8
\item
  (c) 34
\item
  (d) 66
\item
  (e) None of the above.
\end{itemize}
statement_raw:
'''Multiple Choice'''

The number of primitive roots of 99 is

* (a) 0
* (b) 8
* (c) 34
* (d) 66
* (e) None of the above.
